page.title: 19Watford: The Railways
page.content: Watford is a major station on the old London-Midland-Scotland Railway. In 1984 Watford Junction Station redevelopment was started beside the present station buildings.These buildings were in their day a modernisation of the old Watford Junction Station, part of which can still be seen on the NW side of the St. Albans Road bridge. Two branch lines make a rail link with Croxley Green and St. Albans. The main line provides an inter-city service between London(Euston) and Glasgow. The shortest journey time between London and Glasgow is 5 hours 14 minutes. Watford also has a London Underground station.It is on the Metropolitan Line which runs as far as Aldgate in the East End of London.
